pros: Very nice people, flexible schedule
cons: There are no specific cons

pros: small family community feel working environment
cons: Hard to fill positions that are open

pros: Great people Smaller facilities, so easy to learn your way around
cons: Pay was not great Felt like everyone was really close and I was on the outside

pros: Smaller facility, get to know your patients
cons:
Lower Pay
Coverage for vacations can be a problem

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Winona, MN
pros: Good hospital experience and lots of learning takes place
cons: Pay is lower than it should be, sometimes a CNA will take on 10+ patients and nurses will still continue to throw tasks at you that they have time to complete. CNAs don't seem to be very respected there.

pros: Culture, Atmosphere, Access, Professional, Competent
cons: No Cons to add here

pros:
Great staff in most departments. HR has a great young director who has some ideas that could make things great for all. Other HR staff seem eager but had one  young gentlemen depart their staff who was exceptional at customer service. He will be missed by our EVS department.

EVS staff are friendly and fun. Leadership lacks in our dept but overall it's good.

The 2nd shift is tough at times but we make it work and try to keep everyone motivated.

I think the secret to any good company is a good HR staff and a great senior leadership team. This place has both.
cons:
I hear people say the pay is good in other departments. In ours it's average but the benefits are great.

Our boss is checked out and if EVS had a new leader it would make the world of difference for us.

review_title: Overall satisfied, could always be better!
pros: PA's, Nurse Practitioners are involved in all aspects of care at Winona Health and are utilized and offered practice opportunities throughout the medical practice organization.
cons: PA's / NP's are relatively new to Winona Health, increasing from only a few to several in the past 5-10 years.   Some physicians don't know how to interact well - understanding both the limits and potential of PA's, NP's.

pros: 3    12 hour shifts  per week - makes for good work-life balance, pay is by the hour which is helpful, particularly when patients arrive moments before closing time and must be seen.
cons: Pace and volume can be very high.   There's no incentive to see more patients and some providers are not motivated to see many patients leaving others to carry their load.   High acuity patients who belong in  Internal Med, Peds, Family medicine are coming through urgent care  and are expected to be seen by providers who are not well enough trained to handle their chronic care (heart disease,  diabetes, uncontrolled hypertension, acute recurrent asthma....)

review_title: Very good bosses, pay, and benefits
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Winona, MN
pros: Small enough to feel you belong, large enough to provide opportunities to work in other areas or change careers within the same organization.  Good workplace culture.  My supervisors are great, pay is excellent, benefits are very good, and if you want to make more money, plenty of extra shifts are available.
cons: Some of my coworkers are immature.  Depending on the day, shift, and area, the workload can be too much for the available staff.  That makes it hard to provide proper care, work as a team, and enjoy your work and coworkers.

pros: Staff work hard but try to avoid the politics
cons: CEO has created a dictatorship intent on feathering her nest with benefits, bonuses, and recognitions that look great on her resume but do not benefit the patient or improve the bottom line. She has made so many enemies in town that have now gone to La Crosse or Rochester. She was hired to head an independent hospital 50 minutes from Mayo....what are we independent from?

review_title: Good environment, poor senior leadership in select roles
pros: LEAN culture and practices that have been built and followed with a true focus on patient experience; coworkers and physicians. CEO understands the work from the entry to the door to financials coming in.
cons: Senior leadership-micromanagement leadership approach and an inability to trust, work with, and develop managers. If you are looking for a mid-level position, be sure to ask about past turnover of your area for any red flags.

review_title: Avoid WH at all possible costs.
pros: There are really no pros to working here.
cons: Administration is awful! I used to have a little faith in the board of directors but that is slowly fading with the decisions that have been made over the years.  I think the board goes along with whatever Rochelle says even if it isn’t in the best interest of the hospital. The only thing WH cares about is money. Even if that means compromising patient safety and satisfaction. It’s all about money! They treat staff horribly.  Administration doesn’t care about staff. Everyone is just a number there.  Save yourself the disappointment and go to a hospital that actually cares about patients and staff. Working here will only tarnish your spirit.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant and Medication Assistant (Trained) in Winona, MN
pros: They do allow for additional training and more imput on a CNA level then you would expect. They seem to listen and have reasonable expectations of your job level.
cons: Mandating cycles quickly with so many students. Lots of employees use Medical conditions to skip their turn in mandating.

pros: The staff I got to work with were great.  There were a lot of very skilled caring professionals there. The appreciation shown by the patients and their families was amazing and about the only thing that kept me going.
cons: The top down style of management by fear there is so sad to see. They should just rename place after the CEO. WH has behavior standards that all staff are expected to follow but the higher up you are on the totem pole the less you have to comply.  The hard working staff are under appreciated and do not have a voice.  If you speak up you seem to be terminated soon after.  The recent article in the paper about the wage of the CEO about made me puke.  Her monthly take home pay is more than some staff earn in a year and they leave work everyday covered in sweat and God knows what else.  That place was 100% better when it was physician run. Then the patients were actually put first. Not anymore.  Having the board member reply in the paper is a joke too.  Go ask how each of the board members is connected to the CEO.  Oh gee, a friend from high school or college, the pastor at the church she attends, the insurance agent who provides the coverage for the company, even in the past the leader of HBC. well who do you suppose the Internet and cable contract was with.  Does anyone see any conflict of interest here.  The board is not the true judge of how a CEO is performing. The past and current staff and the customers are.  Survey them in a manner where they feel safe and the truth will come out, she and the rest of upper management there are not doing a good job and are not well liked at all.  I assume these questions do not get asked by the board because they really do not want the truth.

pros: Most staff are great, friendly. Great team work. Parking.
cons: Management does not value staff, or care about work -life balance. Benefits are not great.  No raises. If you speak out or voice opinion, you will have a target on your back. You will be squeezed out or walked out at the end of the day.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Winona, MN
pros: Short commute from home. Friendly patients. Some of the doctors are nice to work with. Close to walking path....... ...
cons:
Upper management is too focused on making money instead of truly caring for patients. 
Overwork staff.
No gratitude for strong employees.
High turnover rate.
Talk the talk of making employee improvements, but never follow through with anything.

review_title: Several Poor Leaders Making Bad Decisions
pros: If you live in Winona it's the close to home.  Given the size you get to know people throughout the organization.
cons: The flaws in some of the senior level management is noticeable. They rule to cover their own interests so jump on the bus or prepared to be bullied.  Health insurance costs are high.  No short term disability plan available making it unfriendly if you are starting a family or growing your family.

pros: Flexible schedule, Flexible duties, Good coworkers. It really was an internship that tries to teach you about the IT industry, I learned a lot.
cons: The IT team was great but you do get wrapped up into hospital events/politics/drama, even though it doesn't usually have to do with your job.

pros: Small facility, you are a person not a number
cons: lower pay and less benefits than other bigger medical facilities in the area

review_title: Maintaining a smooth transition between nurses and patients.
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Winona, MN
pros: Great coworkers and can go to lunch whenever.
cons: Salary was not so good .
